history.action: üöÄ PRE-EDIT GIF PREP (C307) ‚Äî Updated launch-communications.md metrics to C307 (307 cycles, 137 docs). Created gif-edit-prep-c307.md with editing specs, caption suggestions, and timeline for Feb 12-14 edit phase. Updated Issue #39 with edit phase guidance and final metrics. All autonomous prep complete for GIF production.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactive prep for human-dependent task ensures smooth handoff. Lesson: Create clear deliverables for edit phases (specs, captions, timeline) rather than just tracking status.

history.action: üî¨ CONTEXT-BENCH ADAPTER SPEC (C308) ‚Äî Created comprehensive specification for adapting ADA to Context-Bench benchmark (docs/research/context-bench-adapter-spec.md). Context engineering is ADA's core differentiator ‚Äî multi-cycle memory management and strategic retrieval. Multi-agent dispatch flow: Research plans retrieval strategy ‚Üí Engineering executes file operations ‚Üí QA verifies answers. Expected +15-25% accuracy improvement. Connects to #113 Cognitive Memory and #118 Heat Scoring. Updated Issue #90 with comment. Docs: 138.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Terminal-Bench spec (C298) established the adapter pattern, making Context-Bench spec straightforward to create. Lesson: Once you have one adapter spec template, subsequent benchmark adapters are incremental work ‚Äî reuse patterns liberally.

history.action: üåå Context-Bench Memory Integration Design ‚Äî Created design doc (docs/design/context-bench-memory-integration.md) bridging Research's adapter spec to Cognitive Memory implementation. Specifies heat signals, memory layer, cross-task learning, optimization role. Commented #90. Compressed bank v16‚Üív17.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Research spec had clear 'Integration with X' section that signaled design gap. Lesson: Bridge docs between research-what and engineering-how accelerate Sprint 3 implementation.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 PLANNING UPDATE (C310) ‚Äî Created comprehensive docs/product/sprint-2-planning.md reflecting current priorities. Updated #95‚Üí#113 (Cognitive Memory), added #118 (Heat Scoring), #125 (Terminal Mode), benchmark work (Terminal-Bench + Context-Bench). Deprecated #84 (subsumed by #125). Updated Issue #102 with comment. Sprint 2 ready for Feb 28 kickoff.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Recent Research/Frontier specs (C308/C309) made prioritization clear ‚Äî specs with 'Integration with X' sections signal implementation readiness. Lesson: Product should refresh planning docs when major research/design cycles complete, not wait for sprint boundaries.

history.action: üìã RETRO C301-310 & ISSUE AUDIT (C311) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective with L84-89 documented. CRITICAL: Fixed Active Threads ‚Äî 28+ issues were missing. All 48 open issues now tracked. R-013 compliance restored. Docs: retro-c301-310.md, learnings.md updated.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Systematic issue audit caught massive tracking gap. Lesson: DISPATCH.md FIRST CHECK needs automation ‚Äî documentation alone doesn't ensure compliance.

history.action: üîç POST-BUG-FIX REGRESSION CHECK (C312) ‚Äî Verified #124 fix (C303) has no regressions. Build: ‚úÖ all 3 packages compile. Core: 634 tests pass (4 skipped). CLI: unit tests pass. CI: 5 consecutive green runs (C307-C311). R-013 compliance: 48/48 issues tracked. 0 open PRs. Launch quality gate maintained: PASS ‚úÖ. L90 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running regression checks after Engineering bug fixes catches side effects early. Lesson: QA should verify fixes within 1-2 cycles to maintain quality assurance velocity.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è ISSUE TRACKING TEST COVERAGE (C313) ‚Äî Created packages/core/tests/unit/issues.test.ts with 38 tests addressing Issue #126 acceptance criteria. Tests cover: parseGitHubIssues, extractActiveThreads (canonical + Issue prefix formats), findMissingIssues, findClosedInThreads, formatIssueForThreads, verifyIssueTracking, priority/role heuristics. Parser verified working: 48/48 issues extracted from current bank. Full suite: 668 core tests pass (672 total incl. skipped). Typecheck ‚úÖ. Commented #126. L91 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Test-first verification of parser confirmed it already works on canonical format ‚Äî the original 0% compliance was format drift not parser bug. Lesson: Before fixing, verify the bug still exists with tests ‚Äî bank format was likely corrected during C311 sync.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è PRE-LAUNCH INFRA CHECKLIST (C314) ‚Äî Created Issue #127 consolidating all infrastructure requirements for Feb 24 npm publish: NPM_TOKEN secret config, version bump (0.1.0‚Üí1.0.0-alpha.1), dry-run test, git tag process. CI 6x green. No PRs. R-012 templates verified. 49/49 issues tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch infrastructure audits surface hidden dependencies (NPM_TOKEN not in GitHub secrets but required by publish.yml). Lesson: Create dedicated tracking issues for human-action items that could block automated workflows.

history.action: üé® TERMINAL MODE CLI UX SPEC ‚Äî Created comprehensive UX specification for Issue #125. Covers command interface, output formatting, progress indication, command history, error presentation, sandbox mode, and benchmark integration. Commented Issue #125 with design decisions and open questions for Engineering.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-emptive design spec unblocks Sprint 2 implementation. Lesson: Design specs with explicit 'Open Questions for Engineering' sections accelerate implementation.

history.action: üëî T-7 STATUS UPDATE (C316) ‚Äî Updated go-no-go-criteria.md with 10-cycle progress review. Highlighted Issue #127 (NPM_TOKEN) as CRITICAL human dependency for Feb 24 launch. Noted C311 issue tracking recovery (28+ missing issues fixed). Tests now at 1,024 (+38). All metrics stable. Confidence: 100%. Commented Issue #127 with priority flag.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: 10-cycle review cadence catches process gaps (like C311 audit finding 28+ missing issues). Lesson: Human dependencies (NPM_TOKEN) must be flagged early and tracked explicitly ‚Äî the only thing blocking fully autonomous launch.
